title: RRB Group D Recruitment 2026
description:
Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) has announced Group D (Level-1) recruitment for Indian Railways.

Posts Included: Track Maintainer, Helper, Assistant Pointsman and other technical and non-technical posts across various railway zones.

Eligibility Criteria: Candidates must have passed 10th class or possess ITI from a recognized board. Age limit and category-wise relaxation will be applicable as per RRB rules.

Selection Process: Selection will be based on Computer Based Test (CBT), Physical Efficiency Test (PET), Document Verification and Medical Examination.

Important Note: Candidates should carefully read the official notification before applying. Final selection will be strictly according to RRB recruitment norms.

title: RBI Office Assistant Recruitment 2026
description:
Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has released the Office Assistant recruitment notification for 2026.

Post Details: Office Assistant (Support Staff) in various RBI regional offices.

Eligibility Criteria: Candidates must have passed 10th or 12th class from a recognized board. Knowledge of local language is required.

Selection Process: Selection will be done through Written Examination followed by Language Proficiency Test (LPT).

Important Note: Candidates must apply online only through the official RBI website. Selection will be purely merit-based.

title: PSSSB Group D Recruitment 2026
description:
Punjab Subordinate Services Selection Board (PSSSB) has released Group D recruitment notification for various departments of Punjab Government.

Posts Included: Peon, Chowkidar, Helper and other Class IV posts.

Eligibility Criteria: Candidates must have passed 10th class with Punjabi as a subject. Age limit will be applicable as per Punjab Government rules.

Selection Process: Selection will be based on Written Examination followed by Document Verification.

Important Note: Candidates are advised to check category-wise vacancy details before applying.

title: CTET Admit Card 2026 Released
qualification: For CTET Paper I & II Candidates
lastdate: Exam date as per admit card
description:
Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has released the CTET 2026 Admit Card.

Exam Details: CTET Paper I and Paper II will be conducted as per the schedule mentioned on the admit card.

How to Download: Candidates can download their admit card using application number and date of birth.

Important Instructions: Candidates must carry a printed admit card along with a valid photo ID to the examination centre.

title: PSSSB Group D Admit Card 2025
description:
Punjab Subordinate Services Selection Board (PSSSB) has released the Group D examination admit card.

Exam Details: Admit card contains exam date, time and exam centre information.

Important Note: Candidates must download and print the admit card before the examination date.

title: Punjab Police Constable Result 2025
description:
Punjab Police has declared the Constable examination result 2025.

Result Details: Candidates can check their result using roll number or registration details.

Next Step: Shortlisted candidates will be called for the next stage as per Punjab Police recruitment process.

title: PSSSB Clerk Recruitment 2026
description:
Punjab Subordinate Services Selection Board (PSSSB) has released Clerk and Clerk (IT) recruitment notification 2026.

Post Details: Clerk and Clerk (IT) under Group C category.

Eligibility Criteria: Candidates must have Graduation along with Computer Certificate or Computer as a subject.

Selection Process: Written Examination followed by Typing Test and Document Verification.

title: Indian Air Force Agniveer Vayu Intake 01/2027 Recruitment
description:
Indian Air Force has released the Agniveer Vayu Intake 01/2027 notification under the Agnipath Scheme.

Service Period: Selected candidates will serve for a period of 4 years.

Eligibility Criteria: 10+2 with Physics and Mathematics OR 3 Year Diploma in Engineering OR 2 Year Vocational Course.

Selection Process: Online Written Test, Physical Fitness Test (PFT), Adaptability Tests and Medical Examination.

Important Note: Only unmarried male and female candidates are eligible to apply.
